Come create the technology that helps the world act together 
  Nokia is committed to innovation and technology leadership across mobile, fixed and cloud networks. Your career here will have a positive impact on people’s lives and will help us build the capabilities needed for a more productive, sustainable, and inclusive world.
   
   
  We challenge ourselves to create an inclusive way of working where we are open to new ideas, empowered to take risks and fearless to bring our authentic selves to work.
   
   
  The team you’ll be part of
   
   
  As Nokia's growth engine, we create value for communication service providers and enterprise customers by leading the transition to cloud-native software and as-a-service delivery models. Our inclusive team of dreamers, doers and disruptors push the limits from impossible to possible.
   
   
  
   You’ll join the fast growing organization Managed Security Services, leading the Security Services delivered by Nokia and dedicated to secure critical infrastructure against modern day security threats, including disruptive technologies such as Cloud, IoT, virtualization, 5G, etc. 
   The Product Line is thus responsible for many activities, such as conceptualization of products, identification of target addressable market, planning & budgeting, business case development, writing customer value proposition and go-to-market strategy, development of sales/pre-sales capability, pushing marketing initiatives, organising delivery models & readiness including program for capability development, incubation of products , market launch, sustenance & growth management as well as P&L governance. 
   As part of Managed Security Services Product Line, you’ll be able to get involved in these tasks and contribute to the success of this business.
  
   
   
  What you will learn and contribute to
   
   
  Job summary
   
   
  Nokia is looking for a subject expert to lead, coordinates, communicates, integrates, and be accountable for the overall success of the Penetration Testing Security Management Services, with focus on the organization's systems, networks and applications to identify security vulnerabilities and potential threats. This includes researching and evaluating new and existing security solutions, developing and implementing penetration testing methodologies, and providing technical guidance to other teams.
   
  
  Main Responsibility Areas: 
  Subject matter expertise (20%): 
  
   Act as a technical subject matter expert (SME) for penetration testing and vulnerability assessments on the systems, networks, applications networking and operating system (install, config, admin). 
   Staying up-to-date with the latest penetration testing techniques and trends, and making recommendations for improvements to the organization's security posture. 
   Ensure a technology watch on emerging 3GPP security requirements (e.g., 4G, 5G, etc.), ITU-T x.805, ISO27001, NIST, MITRE ATT&CK framework, and related standards.
  
   
   
  
  Pre-sales support (40%): 
  
   Provide a support to pre-sales’ technical inquiries, assess the customers’ requirements, design technical and business-sound solutions, and attend customers’ meetings to provide technical clarifications and presentations (possibly requiring travelling). 
   Review organizations’ penetration testing methodologies, to identify and exploit vulnerabilities in the customer infrastructure and recommend enhancements. 
   Providing technical guidance and expertise on penetration testing and vulnerability assessments to other teams and departments of organisations
  
   
   
  Product development (40%): 
  
   Develop practice and service blueprint around penetration testing as a service. 
   Work closely with product vendors and partners to select and assess new security products, follow-up on their features’ roadmaps and provide a support to product management’s technical inquiries. 
   Design, build, implement and test cloud security solutions for complex IT and Telecom infrastructures. 
   Create technical documentations, presentations and deliver competence development materials and trainings to relevant key stakeholders.
  
   
   
  Your skills and experience
   
  
  Technical Competencies: 
  
   Masters or bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field such as cyber security 
   Minimum 5 years of experience in a penetration testing or vulnerability assessment role. With certifications such as OSCP, GPEN, CEH, and CREST. 
   Strong knowledge of penetration testing methodologies, tools and techniques. 
   Experience with vulnerability scanning tools, such as Nessus, OpenVAS, and Qualys. 
   Experience with web application penetration testing frameworks, such as OWASP ZAP and Burp Suite.
  
   
   
  Soft Skills: 
  
   High level of personal integrity, as well as the ability to professionally handle confidential matters and show an appropriate level of judgment and maturity. 
   Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain complex security concepts to non-technical audiences. 
   Strong project management skills, with the ability to lead and manage penetration testing projects. 
   Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify and exploit vulnerabilities in systems, networks, and applications. 
   Must be a critical thinker, with strong problem-solving skills. 
   
  Nice to Have: 
  
   Experience with cloud infrastructure and security is a plus. 
   Knowledge of network security architecture concepts and principles (e.g., defense-in-depth).
  
   
   
  What we offer 
  Nokia offers flexible and hybrid working schemes, continuous learning opportunities, well-being programs to support you mentally and physically, opportunities to join and get supported by employee resource groups, mentoring programs and highly diverse teams with an inclusive culture where people thrive and are empowered.
   
   
  Nokia is committed to inclusion and is an equal opportunity employer
   
   
  Nokia has received the following recognitions for its commitment to inclusion & equality: 
  
   One of the World’s Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere 
   Gender-Equality Index by Bloomberg 
   Workplace Pride Global Benchmark 
   LGBT+ equality & best place to work by HRC Foundation
  
   
   
  At Nokia, we act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people.
   
  
  Nokia’s employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. 
  We are committed to a culture of inclusion built upon our core value of respect.
   
  
  Join us and be part of a company where you will feel included and empowered to succeed.

Bengaluru, Karnataka, India
   
   
  Job Description 
  
  
   
    
     
      About The Company:
       
     
    
     
    
     
      ARA’s client is a leading IT solutions provider, offering Applications, Business Process Outsourcing (BPO), and Infrastructure services globally through a combination of technology know-how, domain, and process expertise. The accolades it has been garnering can be attributed to their undeterred focus on delivering quality solutions across verticals that meet the challenging requirements of their esteemed customers. They have also been ranked 29 of the 100 largest financial technology vendors by American Banker and BAI in the FinTech Forward Top 100 rankings.
       
     
    
     
    
     
      The Role:
       
     
    
     
    
     
      SOC Detection Engineer - L3 
      We are currently recruiting for an exciting role as an “IT CoE SEC SOC Detection Eng - L3”. You will be working as part of the SOC Center of Excellence for a large pharmaceutical company, and you will be involved in safeguarding environments against Cybersecurity threats. 
      As a Detection Engineer you will be responsible for creating the appropriate detections to ensure that our SOC is able to timely catch malicious activity.
       
     
    
     
    
     
      Key Responsibilities:
       
     
    
     
    
     
      
       Effectively identify threats by performing relevant research and data analysis. 
      
      
       Follow up on Cyber Threat Intelligence information and maintain the backlog of detection use cases. 
       Perform mapping of detection use cases against relevant frameworks e.g. Mitre Att&ck and perform gap analysis against them (both detection and data gaps). 
       Create and tune/improve detections for our SIEM and XDR platforms (KQL). 
       Create analysis playbooks both in the wiki as well as the SOAR platform. 
       Improve the SOC workflow through automation. 
       Create meaningful dashboards, reports, and visualizations. 
       Create threat emulations for the most important detection in order to continiously test our detection capabilities. 
       Execute deep dives and threat hunts using the TAHiTi methodology.
      
       
     
    
     
    
     
      Skills Required:
       
     
    
     
    
     
      
       Knowledge and experience across the information security domain, such as endpoint security, identity management, cloud security, detection engineering, vulnerability management, incident response, and threat intelligence. 
       You have hands-on experience investigating security events and incidents across complex and heterogeneous environments 
       Expert Knowledge of TTP's used by various threat actors (Mitre Att&ck) and how to detect them. 
       Strong understanding of Windows and Linux operating systems and command line tools. 
       Good knowledge of Windows security logs. 
       Good understanding of network technologies. 
       Good understanding of Azure & O365 Cloud and the security technologies around it. 
       Ability to wite detection queries in MS-KQL 
       Basic Proficiency in Python and Powershell 
       Basic proficiency in Jupyter notebooks (and MSTICpy) is a plus 
       Experience in creating analysis playbooks 
       Malware incident analysis - ability to interprete sandbox results, perform basic static and maldoc analysis. 
       Experience with Threat Emulation tools is a plus 
      
      Mandatory Skills 
      Tools: 
      
       Azure Sentinel 
       Azure Data explorer 
       Microsoft KQL 
       Knowledge of the data produced by Defender for Endpoint, Defender for Identity, O365, Defender for CloudApps, Defender for Cloud, Azure telemetry 
       Threat emulation tools: Atomic Red Team, Caldera, Prelude, AttaqIQ 
       Cortex XSOAR playbook and automation development
      
       
     
    
     
    
     
      Qualifications & Experience:
       
     
    
     
    
     
      
       Bachelor's Degree in Computer science or any related field, but we prefer experience over education. 
       Prior experience as a network or system administrator is a serious plus. 
       Prior experience in a SOC analyst role is preferred. 
       2+ years of experience in creating SIEM detection use cases. 
      
     
    
     
   
  
  
  Required Skills SOC Analyst, SIEM detection, Azure sentinel, Azure data explorer, Microsoft KQL, cloudapps, O365, Atomic red team, caldera, prelude, attaqIQ, cortex XSOUR, automation development, MS-KQL, Python, Powershell, Windows security logs 
  Educational Qualification Bachelor's Degree in Computer science or any related field, but we prefer experience over education. 
 
 
  
   Nov 09, 2022 
   
    Pay Rate 
    1500000 - 1800000 INR Per Annum 
   
   
    
     5 - 8 Years Exp. 
     2 Vacancies

Scope: 
  Candidate must display an excellent understanding of security technology for infrastructure using endpoint protection, SIEM, Firewalls, VPN, IDS/IPS, Web-Proxy, and Security Audits. Top candidates will be comfortable working with a variety of technologies, security problems, and launching new security solutions.
 
  Primary Responsibilities: 
 
  Lead the planning and implementation of cybersecurity projects/initiatives related to Infrastructure, Network, Endpoint, Cloud Security and Operational Technology Security
  
 
  Lead and collaborate closely with Security, Infrastructure, Network, Local IT and Application teams for the delivery of new/upgraded security controls and systems.
  
 
  Proactively work with Security, Infrastructure, and Network teams to identify security gaps and propose actions to remediate those gaps.
  
 
  Provide detailed initiative tracking with progress to committed dates and escalate issues which jeopardize delivery. Work with teams to develop alternatives to meet commitments.
  
 
  Manage multiple and/or complex projects which support cyber security initiatives in multiple areas and geographies
 
 
  Competencies Required and Experience: 
 
  Ability to work on multiple assignments simultaneously and prioritize projects
  
 
  Ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment
  
 
  Strong attention to detail and outstanding problem-solving skills.
  
 
  Excellent verbal and written communications skills, and strong team orientation
  
 
  Looking for overall 10+ years of experience with minimum 5 years experience with security controls and systems including Endpoint Security, Firewalls/Proxy/VPN service, MS Azure Tenant, Intune, Office 365 Security, SIEM systems.
  
 
  Minimum 5 years experience with Infrastructure Hardware Architecture including Hardening Specifications and configurations.
  
 
  Proven ability to learn quickly and understand a wide variety of business and technical subjects.
  
 
  Demonstrated understanding of IT process and infrastructure/security related projects
  
 
  Able to research information, problem solve and take initiative
  
 
  Able to hold teams and individuals accountable and lead change efforts
  
 
  Prior experience as Project Manager for implementation of Security Technologies, Solutions, and Tools for large enterprises.
  
 
  Experience managing and delivering Security projects that involves integrating various technologies and/or replacement of older security technologies with newer ones.
  
 
  Familiarity with a broad spectrum of industry leading security infrastructure solutions.
  
  Qualifications 
 
  Engineering Graduate or Post Graduate in Information Technology or related field
  
 
  CISSP, GSEC, or CISM certification desired

Job Description 
 
  Skills and Qualifications
  
  
    7+ years of Information Security or engineering experience. 3+ years of direct experience in at least one Public Cloud (AWS or Azure). 
    Work closely with Product Security, Engineering, Operations, and Corporate Security to define security strategy and execute on it. Implementing automation to enable developers to easily consume security services. 
    Improve the accessibility of security through automation, continuous integration pipelines, and other means. Designing a secure application-release automation process to make security an integral part of the CI/CD pipelines. 
    Enforce standard methodologies, processes and tools and ensure compliance to enterprise architecture, global information security policies and engineering strategy. 
    Validate adherence to AWS and Azure governance standards for policy definitions, role-based access controls, ARM Templates, resource groups and Azure Blueprints. 
    Identify security tools and lead operationalization of solutions from POC to Production, e.g. API Threat Protection, Container Security, etc. Streamline POC processes. 
    Implement automation to investigation and response workflows for Automated Incident Response. 
    Encourage others to seek opportunities for different and innovative approaches to addressing problems; facilitate the implementation and acceptance of change. 
    Produce and streamline audit evidence. 
    Stay current on threats, vulnerabilities, and controls. 
    Familiarity with SecOps processes i.e., detection, monitoring, alerting and threat intelligence. 
    Proficiency in scripting using Bash, Python. 
    Expert knowledge with integrating crucial security tasks into CI/CD pipelines. 
    Strong knowledge of software development methodologies and the software development lifecycle. 
    Strong knowledge of container security, DevSecOps Tools and Security controls. 
    Working experience with configuration management. 
    Experience with Azure technologies in general, such as Service Fabric, Application Service Environment, Azure Kubernetes Service, Azure SQL, Cosmos, Azure APIM, Azure AD, Azure OMS/Application Insights, Global Traffic Manager, etc. 
    Experience with AWS technologies, such as CodePipeline, CodeBuild, CodeDeploy, CodeStar, Guardrails, Amazon ECS, AWS Lambda, etc.

Giorgi Global Holdings, Inc. (“GGH”) is a privately held, diversified consumer products/ packaging company with approximately 11,000 employees and operations in 20 countries.
   
  
  
  
   
     GGH consists of four US based companies (The Giorgi Companies) and one global packaging company (CANPACK Group).
   
  
 
 
 
   CANPACK Group is a global manufacturer of environmentally friendly, modern packaging solutions, supplying top quality primary packaging, on time and wherever needed. The company, headquartered in Krakow (Poland), runs operations in 16 countries and employs over 8,000 people worldwide in 29 production sites for aluminum beverage cans, glass bottles, metal closures and containers for food and chemical industries. For 30 years the company has been consequently developing its business to become one of the leading global players on the international packaging market.
 
 
   We are currently looking for:
 
 
 
   SENIOR GLOBAL IT SECURITY SPECIALIST (Operational Technology)
 
 
 
  
   
     This role will ensure continuous operating on IT Security across GGH environment. You will be responsible for daily basis IT Security related work like support for security incidents, cooperation with MSSP team, work with IT Security related products (like DLP, PAM) and cooperation with business and IT teams.
   
  
  
  
   
     Additionally in this role you will oversee organization, transformation, governance, and guidance to the existing OT environment and IT aspects of physical security. Person in this role will be responsible for supervision of IT physical security in all company locations, especially:
   
   
    
     
       cooperate with OT and infrastructure teams in implementing best practices and mitigating controls to potential gaps
     
    
     
       document best OT cybersecurity practices and guide local teams on implementation.
     
    
     
       monitor the status of implementation of practices and resources required
     
   
  
 
 
 
  
   
     Challenges & Opportunities
   
  
 
 
  
   
     You’ll have opportunity to work in a global IT Security Team. You will provide technical expertise in various areas of IT Security in GGH environment.
   
  
  
  
   
     Expectations & Qualifications
   
  
  
   
    
     
       Bachelors or master’s degree in computer sciences, information security or information technology fields
     
    
     
       5+ years of experience in IT Security
     
    
     
       Familiar with IT physical security solutions (i.e., Access Control, CCTV, etc.)
     
    
     
       Familiar with industry standard security best practices
     
    
     
       Understanding basic technical concepts like networking, cloud computing, operating systems
     
    
     
       Analytical and problem-solving skills
     
    
     
       Ability to work in cross functional teams, including remote and external resources
     
    
     
       Excel at prioritizing work and other demands for self and team including making risk-based decisions about remediation recommendations
     
    
     
       Ability to effectively communicate with technical resources
     
    
     
       Ability to understand and develop enterprise policy and technical standards with specific regard to OT management and secure configurationAbility and willingness to learn new things about OT management and overall security operations
     
    
     
       Strong English verbal and written communication skills
     
   
  
 
 
 
  
   
    
     
       Nice to have
     
    
   
   
   
    
     
      
       
         Experience in IT/OT security management or related field will be a plus
       
      
       
         Preferred understanding of various general OT protocols, and specific vendor related
       
      
       
         Preferred understanding of OT security concepts
       
      
       
         Knowledge of NIST, ISO 27001/27400 controls
       
     
    
    
    
     
       We offer:
     
     
      
       
         A chance to work in a fast-growing global company
       
      
       
         The opportunity to take part in shaping global organization's security practices
       
      
       
         Fast-paced, challenging environment with great professional growth opportunities
       
      
       
         Collaborative culture with strong quality and innovation focus
       
      
       
         Hybrid working setup (3 days in the office, 2 days remotely)

Job Description: 
 
 
  
   Job Description 
  
 
 
  
   
    
     Life at Grab 
     
     At Grab, every Grabber is guided by The Grab Way, which spells out our mission, how we believe we can achieve it, and our operating principles - the 4Hs: Heart, Hunger, Honour and Humility. These principles guide and help us make decisions as we work to create economic empowerment for the people of Southeast Asia. 
     
     Get to know our Team: 
     
     When you're an engineer at Grab, you are part of the heart and soul of the company. Our passion is anchored in the work that we do, and this is reflected in the impact we make on millions of lives on a daily basis. Our team is empowered by creating amazing services and tools that serve to secure applications and data built for millions of passengers, driving partners, and fellow grabbers. 
     Get to know the Role: 
     
      You will be building and working on multiple security tools, scanners, static and dynamic analyzers, and supporting backend services. 
      You will have an opportunity to learn and research on Application Security domain. 
      It is very important that our team members take initiative to identify problems, and have the right mindset and skillsets to solve them and drive to closure. 
     
     The day-to-day activities: 
     
      Design and implement cutting edge security tools and scanners. 
      Collaborate with experienced Security Engineers to research and build solutions geared towards identifying security issues at scale (1000s of APIs, 100s of microservices, 100s of deployments weekly) 
      Collaborate with platform teams to build solutions that work well with the ecosystem. 
      Evaluate/extend/contribute to existing open-source security tools and integrate them into pipelines. 
      Timely delivery of high quality, maintainable, and operationally excellent code. 
     
     The must-haves: 
     
      A degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Cyber Security or related fields 
      Minimum 6 years of experience in Software Engineering - with strong Computer Science fundamentals in algorithms and data structures . 
      Experience in AWS 
      Experience in CICD pipelines 
      Possess excellent communication, sharp analytical abilities with proven design skills, able to think critically of the current system in terms of growth and stability.

        About Exela
         Exela is a business process automation (BPA) leader, leveraging a global footprint and proprietary technology to provide digital transformation solutions enhancing quality, productivity, and end-user experience. With decades of expertise operating mission-critical processes, Exela serves a growing roster of more than 4,000 customers throughout 50 countries, including over 60% of the Fortune® 100. With foundational technologies spanning information management, workflow automation, and integrated communications, Exela's software and services include multi-industry department solution suites addressing finance & accounting, human capital management, and legal management, as well as industry-specific solutions for banking, healthcare, insurance, and public sectors. - Through cloud-enabled platforms, built on a configurable stack of automation modules, and 17,500+ employees operating in 23 countries, Exela rapidly deploys integrated technology and operations as an end-to-end digital journey partner.
       
        
        
       
        Health & Wellness

In addition, supplemental income protection including short term insurance coverage is available. We also offer a 401(k)-retirement savings plan to assist eligible employees in saving for their retirement. Participants are provided access to financial wellness resources and retirement planning services.

         Exela seeks job applicants from all walks of life and backgrounds including, but not limited to, those who are transitioning military members, veterans, reservists, National Guard members, military spouses and their family members. Individuals will be considered no matter their military rank or specialty.
       
        
      
      
       Job Description 
       
        
         
          
           Role Overview:
          
          
          
            Application Security Specialist is a hands-on tech oriented position. You will play a pivotal role within the Cyber Security Practice and work with delivery teams as well as networks and infrastructure support teams.
          
          
          
            Embed security throughout the lifecycle of software delivery
           Building and defining Security Testing practices
           Play a consultant and advisory role to delivery team and clients
          
          
          
            Responsibilities:
          
          
          
            Work closely with Application Development & IT team and serve as a single point of contact for all security testing related activities
           Executing manual network, application penetration tests and security code reviews
           Analyse application security architecture and understand security threats
           Draw Data Flow Diagrams (DFD), prepare threat models, identify threats and suggest mitigation steps
           Design and execute security test cases
           Create and review security test reports and evidences
           Provide recommendations to clients in fixing vulnerabilities
           Develop frameworks and methodologies to evaluate security in new and emerging technologies including mobile application such as IOS, Android etc.
           Assist in building security testing competency
           Mentor and provide technical guidance to team members in executing test cases
           To define testing criteria for systems and applications.
           Write SOPs, SOW’s
           Technical and Process reviews of the team output – represent the team reports to all stakeholders.
           To work with end clients to develop strategies and plans to enforce security requirements, and remediate identified risks / vulnerabilities.
           Assist in building security testing competency
          
         
        
         
       
      
      
       
        
         Bachelor’s Degree (or equivalent) or advanced degree highly desired.
         5 - 7 years of Security Testing and Project Management Experience
         Good knowledge of network & application security vulnerabilities
         In-depth knowledge and experience with OWASP, SANS, CERT, WASC standards/frameworks for security testing and security code reviews. OSSTMM for network penetration testing
         Experience in manual and automation penetration testing tools and techniques. Should have experience in using tools like Burp, ZAP, Veracode, Fortify, WebInspect, NMap etc.
         Experience in performing threat modelling and identify attack vectors. Must be familiarity with STRIDE and DREAD concepts.
         Must be able to handle tasks/activities with competing priorities
         Must be able to work independently & guide team
         Ability to handle multiple customers simultaneously from different industry verticals
         Ability to manage a diverse team and getting them to deliver as expected
         Ability to handle team challenges and resolve conflicts
         Good verbal and written communication skills with the ability to talk to both business teams and technical teams
         Security certifications such as OSCP, CEH, ECSA, GPEN

 Job Description
  Are you passionate in developing state of the art Cyber security solution for different Automotive control units ? spanning across Vehicle control, Battery Management, Fuel cell control, Oxygen electric air compressor, DC DC Convertor, Inverter control etc.
  With increased security vulnerability for embedded products, improving Security in automotive world is a key challenge worldwide. Our team focuses in understanding security needs, developing platform and customer specific security solutions, analyzing threat and risk and developing robust security test methodology.
 
  Responsible for implementation of security infrastructure software, security functions and support in realization of cyber security in projects
  Analysis of security requirements from OEM's
  Development of security concepts (Threat and Risk analysis, security requirement development)
  Security configurations and function development based on Hardware Security Module(HSM)
  Configuration of Autosar security modules(CSM, CryIF, SecOC, KeyM etc.)
  Function development using C programming language on Electronic Control Units with Multi-core micro-controllers (Tricore AURIX, NXP, ST etc..)
  Development/support in security test concepts/strategies, test automation
  Provide guidance to projects for implementation of Security Engineering Process in project development
 
 
 

 Qualifications
 
   2 to 6 years experience in embedded software development
  Should have knowledge on micro-controllers / microprocessors
  Good in RTOS concepts
  Strong development experience in embedded C and RTOS
  Experience software integration and testing
  Ability to work as part of a dedicated project team
  Experience in configuration management & defect tracking tools
  Understanding of Autosar based security stack ( SecOC, CSM, CRYIF)
  Knowledge in
  - Communication protocols - CAN / Ethernet
  
 
  Tools like CANalyser / CANoe, Lauterbach
  Embedded development tools, methodologies and debugging skills
  HSM will be added advantage
  Version Control Systems – SDOM / SVN /GIT etc..
  Experience in scripting languages like Perl / CAPL / Python etc. is an added advantage
  Automotive domain knowledge is an added advantage
  Excellent Communication and Interpersonal skills
 
  Additional Information
  In our department we are also responsible for SOTA/FOTA, Tester diagnostic, ECU Communication: CAN-FD, Ethernet , Multi/Many core, ECU virtualization, AI/ML application in SW Architecture, Customer boot loader, Resource management etc.

description:
HARMAN’s engineers and designers are creative, purposeful and agile. As part of this team, you’ll combine your technical expertise with innovative ideas to help drive cutting-edge solutions in the car, enterprise and connected ecosystem. Every day, you will push the boundaries of creative design, and HARMAN is committed to providing you with the opportunities, innovative technologies and resources to build a successful career.
 
 
 
   A Career at HARMAN
 
 
 
   As a technology leader that is rapidly on the move, HARMAN is filled with people who are focused on making life better. Innovation, inclusivity and teamwork are a part of our DNA. When you add that to the challenges we take on and solve together, you’ll discover that at HARMAN you can grow, make a difference and be proud of the work you do everyday.
 
 
 
   Position Summary: Briefly describe the primary purpose and function of this position.
 
 
 
   Senior Subject Matter Expert on Automotive Infotainment System or any ECU, who is responsible for the delivery, planning, execution and product development for Automotive products with quality and by following the engineering practices. The candidate should be a team player who should be able manage team, manage delivery, customer intractions , Cross Team interactions & able to understand design wherever needed on the existing product and also takes the responsibility in porting the existing product to a new platform
 
 
 
   Supervisory Responsibilities:
 
 
 
   Yes , Max 15 highly technical members
 
 
 
   Job Responsibilities:
 
 
   Mandatory - Experience in Automotive industry – great if it’s Infotainment System IVI.
   Mandatory - Experience in managing team, Project Planning, Risk Planning, Cost and Budget Planning, Process implementation, RFQ and Requirements understanding, Customer requirement prioritization
   Mandatory - Experience of Team handling, customer interactions, Automotive OEM understanding, Cross Team player, very detailed oriented person to update status(this is not a status update) etc
   Mandatory - Experience of practically handling of Automotive OEMs wrt technical & mgmt. both.
   Mandatory - Experience in managing Technical dependencies , resolution of dependencies on time & understanding of commitments to OEMs to deliver on time
   Mandatory - Experience in team Hiring, create motivation to team, Leadership, task/assignment delegation etc
   Mandatory- High Level Knowledge on any system like linux or Android
   Good to have – Handson on some tools like ALM, JIRA, Confluence, DOORs, EA etc
   Good to have if candidate has expetience in gandling SOCs vendors and other 3rd party vendors- will be great if he has experience in handling TEE vendors
   Good to have- Familiarity/experience with embedded automotive cyber security management & secure development life cycle
   Good to have - High Level understanding of “Programming Model” of cryptography hardware, random number generators, key hashing, key wrapping, and certificate like X509
   Good to have - Experience on application security , Network security and secure communication
   Good to have - High level understanding of UNECE & ISO 21434
   Good to have - Android system , Android security android infrastructure
   Good to have - Deep Understanding of using cryptography, secure key storage, key exchange methods, and trusted platform architectures
   Good to have - Complete understanding of secure boot, secure kernel on any SoCs
   Good to have - Working with SoC/IoC vendors , architect end-to-end security solutions based on a strong root-of-trust.
 
 
 
   Basic Qualifications:
 
 
   B-Tech/BE/MS/M Tech with 12 years to 18 years having at-least 4 years experience of team management & at-least 5 years of experience in embedded automotive system.
   Programming languages – C/C++
 
 
 
   Preferred Qualifications & Desired Competencies:
 
 
   Can-do attitude with unwavering sense of urgency
   Ability to learn new technologies quickly.
   Self-motivated, results-driven individual and passionate about work.
   Excellent communication skills and problem solving skill
 
 
 
   Leadership:
 
 
   Demonstrate character, clarity, courage and commitment to high-performance
   Build environment of trust, high performance and engagement by establishing clear goals and a commitment to feedback, development and recognition
 
 
 
   Change Orientation:
 
 
   Champion a better, faster and simpler way of doing things
   Apply original thinking and continuous improvement to processes, products, systems or services and manage change to better serve customer needs
 
 
 
   Collaboration:
 
 
   Connect, engage and communicate with others
   Encourage open expression of ideas; communicate effectively at all levels and build strong relationships
 
 
 
   Judgment:
 
 
   Make sound decisions
   Demonstrate critical thinking to take appropriate risk and make sound and timely decisions
 
 
 
   Results-Driven:
 
 
   Deliver extraordinary results
   Take initiative to achieve superior, quality results against internal or external standards of excellence
 
 
 
   Eligibility Requirements: List specific location of position and % of willingness to travel.
 
 
   Willingness to travel.
   Willingness to work in an office.
   Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background investigation and drug screen.
 
 
 
   Other:
 
 
 
   About HARMAN International
 
 
   Headquartered in Stamford, Connecticut, HARMAN (NYSE:HAR) designs, manufactures and markets premier audio, visual, infotainment and enterprise automation solutions for the automotive, consumer and professional markets. With leading brands including AKG®, Harman Kardon®, Infinity®, JBL®, Lexicon®, Mark Levinson ® and Revel®, the Company is admired by audiophiles, musicians and the entertainment venues where they perform. More than 25 million automobiles on the road today are equipped with HARMAN audio and infotainment systems. HARMAN has a workforce of approximately 17,600 people across the Americas, Europe, and Asia and reported sales of $5.9 billion during the last 12 months ended December 31, 2014. HARMAN is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action employer. Minorities, women, veterans and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply. HARMAN offers a great work environment, challenging career opportunities, professional training and competitive compensation. Looking for a challenge where your experience is valued? Come see what you can achieve as a leader with HARMAN! (www.harman.com)
 
 
 
   HARMAN is an Equal Opportunity /Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race,color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin,disability or Protected Veterans status. HARMAN offers a great work environment, challenging career opportunities, professional training and competitive compensation. (
  
   www.harman.com

Job Description :
 
 
 
   Role details:
 
 
   Lead the engineering function of Cyber Operations and develop the technology solutions to defend Diageo against sophisticated attacks, using best in the class security tools and technologies. This includes building multiple technology solutions in the area of threat detection, incident response, vulnerability management, offensive security and simulations, security analytics and security orchestration and automation solutions. This role will work with a combination of inhouse resources and 3rd party service providers to deploy and support technology stack on a global scale. Execute the cyber strategy by building platforms which leverages latest innovation in security defence and detection technologies, for early detection and respond to cyber-attacks impacting Diageo. This role will interface with other groups such as EA, security SA, Compute, AWS, Azure, Networks, Automations, Applications development organizations and vendors to execute projects.
 
 
 
   Job Description
 
 
   14+ experience in cyber security technologies, with an ability to scale up and deliver any new technologies
   Experience Design, deployment, integration and operation of Cyber Défense technologies – Automation/SOAR, Security Analytics/SIEM, EDR/XDR, CSPM/CWPP platforms from vendors such as Microsoft, Palo Alto, CrowdStrike, etc,.
   Experience in developing content for these platforms – Use cases, playbooks, policies, rules, workflows, etc,.
   Experienced with one or more scripting languages (e.g., Python, PowerShell, Bash, etc.)
   Experience with API (Restful/SOAP) based integrations and data exchanges using JSON, XML and other standards
   Working knowledge of Machine learning/AI and leveraging those models in cyber defence security
   Experience in securing cloud technologies such as Azure and AWS services and APIs
   Demonstrated experience developing and implementing, and managing large-scale security initiatives, by navigating through complex technical and procedural challenges
   Build the best in class security technologies and utilizing a risk-based approach to properly test and introduce them into the overall environment.
   Go getter and has technical deep understanding of security systems at different layers, such as network , cloud, endpoint ,advance malware defense , data security, incident response, etc
   Has excellent understanding of security operations and workflows, and ability to introduce automation themes in these areas

Orbia Advance Corporation is a Purpose-led company with big aspirations. We are out to advance life around the world while maximizing value to our shareholders, customers and employees. The Company is passionate about the topics that define how people will live and thrive tomorrow: the future of cities, buildings, agriculture, and materials. Orbia Advance Corporation has five business groups which offer innovative solutions across multiple industries including building and infrastructure, data communications, chemicals and more. In 2018, Orbia Advance Corporation bought a majority stake in Israeli-based Netafim, the world’s leader in drip irrigation, and is helping the world ‘grow more with less’ as it helps to solve food and water scarcity. Orbia Advance Corporation has operations in 41 countries with more than 22,000 employees. 

 We started as a producer of commodities and have evolved to become a provider of innovative solutions that address the global issues of rapid urbanization, water and food scarcity, and a growing and aging population. We’re already a global leader in Polymers, Fluor, Building & Infrastructure, Datacom, and Precision Irrigation. We have embarked on a CEO-led transformation, as part of our journey to become a truly purpose-led, future fit company. 

 JOB IDENTIFICATION 

 
Company: Orbia 

 
Job Title: Senior Endpoint Security Engineer 

 
Job Type: Full Time 

 
Reports to: Senior Manager – Cloud and Infrastructure Security 

 
Department: Information Technology 

 
Location: Poland, India 

 
MAIN PURPOSE :
 The Security Engineer will provide technical leadership and expertise to help architecting and engineering endpoint security solutions to protect Orbia systems globally, fulfilling business and regulatory and compliance requirements. 

 This role will work closely with Orbia’s Infrastructure Digital Workplace, Hosting and Cybersecurity Teams internally to configure, integrate and deploy enterprise security processes and tools to enable prevention/detection and response of/to malware outbreaks. This role plays a pivotal role in defining, architecting and support the implementation of system hardening standards as well as act as product owner and primary subject matter expert for Orbia end point protection/detection and response toolset. 

 This role will work side by side with infrastructure and other cyber security teams to handle complex L3 security tasks/changes and escalations working with external vendor, as deemed necessary. 

 This role has deep hands-on expertise with the Palo Alto Cortex XDR technology stack as well as with the Microsoft endpoint security suite (Defender for endpoint, Intune policy and config management, Bit-Locker, Local Admin password solution) and Microsoft and Suse Linux OS hardening practices. 

 
EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE REQUIRED :
 
Desirable: Four-year college diploma or university degree in computer science or computer engineering. 

 Deep hands-on expertise with the Palo Alto Cortex XDR technology stack (or similar EDR tool) as well as with the Microsoft endpoint security suite (Defender for endpoint, Intune policy and config management, Bit-Locker, Local Admin password solution). 

 Deep hands-on expertise with Windows and common Linux distribution (e.g., Suse) OS system hardening practices following industry standards such as CIS benchmark. 

 Understanding of common cybersecurity attacks tactics & techniques and how to prevent them engineering endpoint security controls. 

 Understanding business impact and requirements and translate into system security architecture and engineering design. 

 At least one operations-specific Professional certification (e.g., MCSE, MCITP, Microsoft 365 Certified: Security Administrator Associate), CISSP/CCSP or equivalent are highly recommended. 

 Understanding ITIL processes (i.e., Change, Capacity, Event, and Incident Management). 

 Manage technology vendors. 

 8+ year of cybersecurity role. 

 Good Understanding of hosting and network technologies. 

 Knowledge of Compute Environments like VM security and Backup Strategy 

 
LANGUAGE REQUIRED :
 English(Fluently (reading, writing and oral) 

 
MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES :
 Drive the endpoint security architecture and engineering of the Orbia security controls to protect all endpoints across the workplace and hosting (cloud Infra as a service and on-premise) technology footprint. 

 Perform gap analysis of the current workplace and hosting security postures against relevant industry benchmark’s (e.g., CIS benchmarks). 

 Drive endpoint security remediation and hardening initiatives across Global IT owned and business groups owned infrastructure factoring business change impact in close alignment with stakeholders. 

 Act as a primary product owner/subject matter expert for cybersecurity owned endpoint security tools such as Palo Alto Cortex XDR driving continuous improvement of prevention/detection and response policies as well as ensuring Orbia architecture and footprint remains current and aligned to standard. 

 Evaluates and reviews Managed Service Provider performance and metrics periodically performing L3 support and oversight of complex issues/changes. 

 Ongoing integration, feature expansion, reporting, validation, and monitoring of endpoint security controls in close partnership with Orbia Global IT digital workplace and hosting teams. 

 Plans and drives scoping, requirements definition and prioritization activities for large / complex endpoint security projects. 

 Reviews others' architecture designs to ensure selection of appropriate endpoint security technology, efficient use of resources, and effective integration of multiple systems and technology. 

 Obtains input from and formal agreement to requirements from a diverse range of stakeholders. 

 
Our Global brands: Dura-Line, Koura Global, Vestolit, Netafim, Alphagary, Wavin. 

 They offer a broad range of value added solutions and finished products that contribute to customers’ success and ultimate improve the quality of life for people around the world. Along its commitment to good citizenship, Orbia Advance Corporation delivers Total Value to customers, employees and investors worldwide, every day.

Job Description: 
 Demonstrate thorough knowledge of Information Security, Compliance, Risk, Data Privacy, Security Architecture and Design for hosting and security elements within Data Center, Microsoft Azure and other on-prem/cloud hosting environments. Ensure that platforms/solutions are securely architected, designed, built/configured, tested, and deployed as per defined policies, standards, and industry good practices. Be a member of technical architecture and design authority teams providing in-depth expertise to [1] overall platform/solution security topics, [2] required Threat Modelling and Security Assessment methodologies, and [3] threat/risk remediation tools and techniques. Partner, collaborate and build trust relationship with different departments, leaders, stakeholders, vendors, agents, and business operations personnel. Highly integrate with functions and positively influence functional leadership, technology owners, project managers, other architects, engineers, and developers in meeting required security standards. Have a thorough understanding of complex IT systems and technical security concepts and stay up to date with the latest security standards, systems, and protocols, as well as best practice security products. Provide thought leadership on new and industry-leading enterprise-class Security solutions, capabilities, and services. Drive accountable areas for results. Take ownership of the environment, teams, operations, initiatives, and projects within areas of accountability, sometimes in ambiguous circumstances. Initiate and manage projects that will affect other divisions, departments, and functions, as well as the corporate environment. Build and manage a professional, creative, and collaborative team. Take ownership of hiring, training, and developing staff to ensure the team has both the technical and organizational skills to effectively maintain operations and support as measured by established service levels; conduct and oversee evaluations and establish performance goals of the staff; resolve disciplinary problems, grievances, and other sensitive personnel matters. Evangelize and promote IT Security culture across the organization. What would your day look like? Contribute to development and maintenance of the security capability, strategy, roadmaps, and governance of platforms/solutions in applicable domains. Work with other Security Architects to align his/her strategy and roadmaps. Identify and/or develop technical security standards for applicable domains. Develop secure architecture and design patterns. Intimate knowledge of networking and network security technologies, including router, switch, LAN, WAN, Wireless LAN, subnet, zone, Virtual Private Network (VPN), firewall, IDS, IPS, Network Access Control (NAC), proxy, Secure Web Gateway (SWG), etc. Working knowledge of Azure networking and network security technologies, including Virtual Network (VNet), Virtual WAN, ExpressRoute, VPN Gateway, Peering service, Azure Bastion, Traffic Manager, Application Gateway, Firewall, Network Security Group (NSG), Web Application Firewall (WAF), and Virtual Network Endpoints. Be a Subject Matter Expert (SME) on Cisco, Juniper, PaloAlto and Microsoft Azure networking and network security products and technologies. Working knowledge of network security, network appliance configuration, network protocols (TCP/IP, SSL, etc.), networking standards, etc. Intimate knowledge of VMware on-prem hosting technologies (ESXi, vSphere, vCenter, etc.) Microsoft on-prem hosting technologies (Windows Server 2012, 2016, and 2019, System Center, etc.), Microsoft Azure hosting technologies (in the areas of Compute, Container, Web, Database, Storage, other IaaS and PaaS services, Azure Policy, Azure AD, Key Vault, etc.), O365 and PowerBI Drive new technology/product evaluations through Proof of Concept (PoC) with other architects/engineers. Take on technical security leadership for platform/solution implementation and transformation projects in applicable domains. Develop security architecture, design, and blueprints for the target state, and ensure their effective elaboration, validation, and communication within the projects and stakeholders. Collaborate closely with other Security Architects and IT Architects on platform/solution security related matters. Work effectively in multi-vendor environment by working closely with vendors and making full use of their capabilities. Perform Threat Modelling and relevant Security Assessment methodologies, (including configuration review, cloud workload security analysis and Penetration Testing). Identify major platform/solution deficiencies and define/craft pragmatic approaches on how to remediate them at scale. Report on platform/solution security status for applicable domains. Increase awareness among teams by making them familiar with security architecture conceptual skills, security principles, emerging technology benchmarks, DevSecOps principles. , etc. Who are we looking for? 4-year University (Bachelor’s) degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Cyber Security or related field, or equivalent experience. 10 – 15 years of experience in an Information Systems role. 7+ years of relevant IT Security experience. 7+ years of experience in architecting and designing secure installed, web and mobile applications. 3+ years of experience in architecting and designing secure Microsoft Azure cloud services. 5+ years as Security Architect. Knowledge of VMware on-prem hosting technologies (ESXi, vSphere, vCenter, etc.) Microsoft on-prem hosting technologies (Windows Server 2012, 2016, and 2019, System Center, etc.), Microsoft Azure hosting technologies (in the areas of Compute, Container, Web, Database, Storage, other IaaS and PaaS services, Azure Policy, Azure AD, Key Vault, etc.), O365 and PowerBI. Familiarity with Data Science concepts and Unified Data Analytics tools (Databricks, Apache Spark, etc.) Familiarity with Data-warehousing tools (Snowflake, etc.) and ETL tools (Azure Data Factory, etc.) Working knowledge of hosting security standards (ISO/IEC 27002, ISO/IEC 27017, ISO/IEC 27032, NIST SP 800-53, 800-123, 800-125 and 800-144) and Solution oriented, can define various pragmatic alternatives leading to appropriate platform/solution security results. Extensive experience and excellent judgment to plan and accomplish goals on complex issues where analyses of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of variables. Ability to perform work independently with a high degree of initiative and problem-solving skills. Strong technical aptitude, attention to detail and high commitment to quality. Strong communicator with deep technical security skills and, a pragmatist who can think outside the box. CISSP, ISSAP, SANS or equivalent Information Security certifications. Azure Solutions Architect, Azure Security Engineer, MCSE or equivalent Microsoft certifications or equivalent experience. Preferred TOGAF, Open CA, SABSA or equivalent Technology Architecture certifications

Description
The Cloud Security Engineers form part of the Technology Delivery team and are primarily responsible for building and maintaining a cloud environment for deploying security tools and for maintaining the cloud security tools that are used to secure production cloud. This is a proactive role and the successful candidate will have strong analytical and troubleshooting skills and a desire to learn new technologies.
The role would suit someone who has worked with a diverse set of IT/security products across a large on-premise infrastructure managed in house and who has experience of supporting the environment and who has existing experience of working with and securing cloud technologies.
Responsibilities
The responsibilities of the Cloud Security Engineers are:

 the support and maintenance of Cloud Security Tooling and Platforms including:
 implementing policy changes
 performing daily, weekly and monthly checks
 monitoring the availability of systems and responding to alerts
 monitor the capacity of systems & supporting infrastructure and project future capacity
 identifying and resolving issues
 preparing status reviews and reports
 managing support cases to ensure issues are recorded, tracked, resolved, and follow-ups are done in a timely manner


 to maintain a good working knowledge of current infrastructure and future trends
 to deliver excellent customer service
 to work with the third-party suppliers of the Security Products
 to maximise security value from existing investments
 to assist the wider Information Security Engineering team with the development of the security tooling
 to take part in post incident reviews and propose engineering resolution to improve results in any future recurrence

Essential Skills

 Proven experience of supporting IT/Security Infrastructure
 Strong technical background
 Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Cybersecurity Specialization, and 3+ year(s) work experience
 Hands of experience with a least 1 of the main cloud security vendors (Microsoft, Palo Alto Networks, Fortinet, Google Cloud Platform)
 Experience of Cloud Infra Security Tools (e.g. Azure Sentinel, Microsoft Defender for Cloud, Firewall)
 Experience of End User Computing Security Tools (e.g. Antivirus, EDR, Intune, Active Directory, Defender for Office365)
 Experience of Information Security Tools (e.g. Microsoft Information Protection, Titus, Boldon James)


 The ability to pick up and learn new technology approaches and make rapid decisions on the best way to use these technology advancements for the betterment of the overall security posture.
 Excellent communication skills as the ability to communicate effectively, constructively, confidently and professionally is key to the success in the role as is the ability to work with IT and Information Security teams and the wider business.
 An excellent knowledge of Cybersecurity reference architecture and an understanding of the Cyber Kill Chain, MITRE ATT&CK and other security defence and intelligence frameworks.
 Keen attention to detail and excellent analytical skills.
 Ability to actively manage workloads to meet business and department requirements.

Desirable Skills

 One or more technical Security Certifications such as: CompTIA Security+
 One or more cloud certifications such as:
 Microsoft Certified – Security Associate | Expert
 Google – Security Engineer | Sales
 Microsoft Certified - Azure Solutions Architect Expert
 Certified Cloud Security Professional (CCSP)


 Degree in an Information Security / Computing discipline

 Experience with Security Tools such as:

HARMAN’s engineers and designers are creative, purposeful and agile. As part of this team, you’ll combine your technical expertise with innovative ideas to help drive cutting-edge solutions in the car, enterprise and connected ecosystem. Every day, you will push the boundaries of creative design, and HARMAN is committed to providing you with the opportunities, innovative technologies and resources to build a successful career.
 
 
 
   A Career at HARMAN
 
 
 
   As a technology leader that is rapidly on the move, HARMAN is filled with people who are focused on making life better. Innovation, inclusivity and teamwork are a part of our DNA. When you add that to the challenges we take on and solve together, you’ll discover that at HARMAN you can grow, make a difference and be proud of the work you do everyday.
 
 
 
   Job Responsibility:
 
 
   White-Box, Grey Box and Black-box style penetration testing against Automotive devices
   Investigate on Automotive protocols like CAN, UDS and analyze them for points of access and vulnerabilities
   Perform research and contribute on new attack methodology, vulnerability findings.
   Communicate complex vulnerability results to technical and non-technical audience.
   Good understanding about automotive concepts.
   Good understanding about Operating system, networks, and various protocols
   Good understanding about cyber security concepts like cryptography, PKI etc.
   Train and help the team in acquire hardware hacking skills
 
 
 
   Technical Skill-set requirements:
 
 
   3-5 years of relevant professional experience
   Proficiency in programming languages (e.g. C, C++, Java, Python) or any other high level language.
   Vulnerability assessment and penetration testing experience in automotive domain.
   Reverse engineering of system binary level (POSIX, WinAPI) and source code review experience.
   Proficiency in usage of security testing tools to perform pen-testing
   Knowledge in Automotive protocols such as CAN, UDS, LIN, Flexray, Automotive Ethernet
   Knowledge of cryptography is desirable
 
 
 
   HARMAN is an Equal Opportunity /Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race,color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin,disability or Protected Veterans status. HARMAN offers a great work environment, challenging career opportunities, professional training and competitive compensation. (
  
   www.harman.com

description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW
    Our client is a business evolution partner—tailoring solutions that make the most of data to make better business decisions and drive more intelligence into your increasingly digital operations. They use their specialization in analytics, digital interventions, and operations management—alongside deep industry expertise — to deliver solutions that help you outperform the competition.
  
  
  
    ROLE
    Collaborate with senior management and department leaders to identify opportunities to improve cloud security posture and establish a roadmap to mature the cloud security program. Strengthen clients growing Cloud footprint with establishing Cloud Security Architecture, Policies and Governance through strong understanding of cloud-based infrastructure.
  
  
  
    JOB RESPONSIBILITY
    
   
    Evolve and innovate in the areas of cloud security posture management, preventative measures, auto-configuration, and auto-remediation.
    Establish and enable a high security bar for all container environments across repositories, CI/CD pipelines and runtime analysis.
    Grow and nurture relationships with engineering executives and DevOps teams to create a security-by- default culture.
    Streamline the processes of cloud security architecture & technical cloud based 3rd party security reviews.
    Establish cloud security baseline and governance around secure configuration, security observability / audit, cloud and host plane matters, specific service requirements, authentication, authorization, banned products or suppliers, etc.
   
  
  
   Interaction with vendors/ OEMs during Design, Implementation and Troubleshooting and ongoing service management.
  
  
  
    REQUIRED SKILLS
    Working, real-world, knowledge of operationalizing cloud native security tools at scale (AWS Guard Duty, AWS WAF, GCP Security Center)
  
  
    
    EDUCATION 
    Engineering graduate with certification in CISSP / CCSP, ISO Lead Auditor etc.
  
   
   
  
   
    Job Location: India - NCR
    
   
    Experience: 15+ years

Responsibilities:
The Information Security Analyst is responsible for operations and administration of the organization’s enterprise security solutions and processes. The Information Security Analyst investigates and responds to enterprise security events and requests.
· Perform network security monitoring and incident response
· Maintain records of security monitoring and incident response activities
· Monitor and analyze a Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) to identify security issues for remediation.
· Configure, schedule, and review the results of vulnerability scans
· Coordinate account/access reviews
· Gather evidence for compliance audits
· Knowledge of creating Security Information Event Management (SIEM) policy rule sets with simplified matches or regex.
· Run reports and analyze for indicators of compromise.
· Recognize potential, successful, and unsuccessful intrusion attempts and compromises thorough reviews and investigates relevant event detail and summary information.
· Consolidate and conducts comprehensive analysis of threat data obtained from classified, proprietary, and open source resources to provide indication and warnings of impending attacks against unclassified and classified networks.
· Interface with a variety of people in a polite, positive, and professional manner.
· Respond in a timely manner (within documented SLA) to security tickets.
· Be available, ready, and able to promptly handle incoming support requests.
· Communicate alerts regarding intrusions and compromises to network infrastructure, applications and operating systems.
· Assists with implementation of countermeasures or mitigating controls.
· Prepare briefings and reports of analysis methodology and results.
· Adhere to policies, procedures, and security practices.
· -Resolve problems independently and follow documented escalation procedures
· -Recommend changes to Standard Operating Procedures and other similar documentation.
· -Generate end-of-shift reports for documentation and knowledge transfer to subsequent security staff
The Requirements:
· Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or 1-2 years of related experience in Networking, Cybersecurity or IT Infrastructure Industry preferred
· Proficient in Security Information Event Management
· Proven propensity to learn new technologies and skills quickly
· Thrives in a collaborative team environment
· Demonstrates analytical problem-solving skills
· Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Preferred experience:
· Experience in Public Cloud environments
· Excellent verbal, written and presentation skills
· TCP/IP networking (IP addressing, DNS, Routing, Switching, Ports and Protocols)
· Familiarity with information security concepts (OWASP Top 10, CVEs, IoCs, Cryptography)
· Unix / Linux operating systems
· Vulnerability management
· Network Security Devices (IDS/IPS, NGFW, WAF, NGAV)
· Scanning technologies
· Log collection and analysis tools (SIEM)
· Current events in Cyber Security and associated patching and remediation efforts
This job description is not designed to contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required. Nothing in this job description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities at any time.

It’s an exciting time to be at Infoblox. Named a Top 25 Cyber Security Company by The Software Report and one of Inc. magazine’s Best Workplaces for 2020, Infoblox is the leader in cloud-first networking and security services. Our solutions empower organizations to take full advantage of the cloud to deliver network experiences that are inherently simple, scalable, and reliable for everyone. Infoblox customers are among the largest enterprises in the world and include 70% of the Fortune 500, and our success depends on bright, energetic, talented people who share a passion for building the next generation of networking technologies—and having fun along the way.  We are looking for a charismatic and influential Product Sales Security Specialist - SAARC to join our team in Mumbai or Delhi in India. In this role, you will be a thought leader and SME driving opportunity and revenue growth using your deep technical knowledge and wide exposure to the security industry. You will forge new business relationships and leverage existing ones to drive exponential growth within SAARC —collaborating and owning all aspects of the sales cycle and working alongside the enterprise account executives to ensure alignment on account strategy. This is an opportunity to jump in and drive Infoblox’s sales and business development of our BloxOne Threat Defense product suite, which is positioned to become one of the most strategic technology platforms of Infoblox’s future, and to play a critical role in the company’s ongoing success as a leader in network control, security, and cloud solutions.
  You’re the ideal candidate if you’re an experienced and passionate security expert with a robust technical foundation and a flair for selling, advising, and evangelizing. You collaborate and coordinate well across stakeholders and work with a sense of mission to surpass quotas and grow market share. 
 What you’ll do:
 
   Grow revenue and new business through positioning and selling security solutions to expand Infoblox’s security footprint and reputation 
  Partner with regional directors to develop an execution plan and build pipelines 
  Work with account executives to align, prioritize, and define go-to-market strategies within the largest, most strategic, potential up-sell accounts 
  Qualify opportunities and own them through the solutioning phase - convince through product demos and position POC to close deals
   Serve as a trusted advisor to customers and prospects by being the security subject matter expert (versus a product SME)—have the scope and perspective to broadly understand, address, and advise on security issues and the industry landscape 
  Understand and distill complex technical problems in the security industry and articulate them to senior executives and decision-makers
   Identify and understand our clients’ networking and cloud infrastructure environments and how Infoblox’s BloxOne Security solutions can solve customer problems
   Continue to build Infoblox security technology ecosystem to drive messaging and co-sponsorship
   Collaborate with Product Management, providing feedback from customers to improve the effectiveness of the BloxOne Security solutions and the customer experience
   Work with Infoblox’s Product Marketing to develop effective regional messaging 
  Act as a thought leader and evangelist through workshops, events, and speaking engagements to educate the industry on the value of our BloxOne Security solutions 
 
 What you’ll bring:
 
   10+ years of demonstrated success selling SaaS security. An extensive portfolio of mature security relationships across customers, prospects, and channels
   Experience advising and consulting customers on their security strategies, programs, projects, and technology investments. 
  Subject matter expertise on security and cybersecurity technologies for on-premise, cloud, and at the edge, as well as a deep understanding of the security vendor landscape, their offerings, and sales tactics
   Formal sales methodology experience (MEDDIC, Challenger, WS) to accelerate, grow and minimize risk
   Ability to clearly articulate the benefits of the Infoblox product and service solutions portfolio to various client stakeholders
   Ability to collaborate and coordinate across stakeholders, both internal and external 
  Experience leading enablement and training for internal and external Technical Sales teams
   Fundamental understanding of networking, TCP/IP, DNS/DHCP, and security
   A good understanding of cloud networking and cybersecurity technologies, framework, compliance requirements, and risk management. Ability to understand complex technical problems in the networking industry at a business level
   Preferred certifications – CISA, CISSP, ISO27001, CISM, CNE, ITIL, CSP, CCP
   Experience in designing target systems security architecture for cloud and hybrid environments. 
 
 What success looks like:
  After six months, you will…
 
   Be fully assimilated with Infoblox technology solutions
   Contribute to the sales cycle across SAARC
   Be attuned to the Infoblox sales cycle and regional team structure
 
  After about a year, you will… 
 
  Achieve revenue targets and personal objectives
   Provide technical leadership on Infoblox SaaS security solutions and contribute to product development
   Develop effective cross-functional relationships to maximize customer and company value
 
  We’ve got you covered:
  Our holistic benefits package includes coverage of your health, wealth, and wellness—as well as a great work environment, employee programs, and company culture. We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, and generous paid time off to help you balance your life. We have a strong culture and live our values every day—we believe in transparency, curiosity, respect, and above all, having fun while delighting our customers. 
 Why Infoblox?
  We’ve created a culture that embraces diversity, equity, and inclusion and rewards innovation, curiosity, and creativity. We achieve remarkable results by working together in a supportive environment that focuses on continuous learning and embraces change. So, whether you’re a software engineer, marketing manager, customer care pro, or product specialist, you belong here, where you will have the opportunity to grow and develop your career. Check out what it’s like to be a Bloxer. We think you’ll be excited to join our team.  #LI-Hybrid

SonicWall delivers Boundless Cybersecurity for the hyper-distributed era in a work reality where everyone is remote, mobile, and unsecure. SonicWall safeguards organizations mobilizing for their new business normal with seamless protection that stops the most evasive cyberattacks across boundless exposure points and increasingly remote, mobile, and cloud-enabled workforces. By knowing the unknown, providing real-time visibility and enabling breakthrough economics, SonicWall closes the cybersecurity business gap for enterprises, governments and SMBs worldwide. For more information, visit https://www.sonicwall.com/ or follow us on Twitter, LinkedIn, Facebook, and Instagram. 
  Ready to do your part in the cyber arms race? SonicWall offers fun, high-energy work environments at the leading edge of technology, networking, and cybersecurity. Whether you're in sales, marketing, engineering, product management, technical support, or finance, you'll have real opportunities to help protect more than 500,000 organizations across the globe. If you're ready for a career that can impact change — and not just another job — join one of committed and enthusiastic SonicWall teams in offices around the world. 
 
   Job Responsibilities:
   
  
   Become a trusted advisor to our key customers and focused partners to understand their business and technical requirements in order to architect a compelling technical and business solution and clearly define how SonicWall solves specific challenges.
   Provide technology presentations, customized product demonstrations, Proof of Concept exercises and concise architectural design and solution documentation in support of larger opportunities and RFP responses.
   Provide presales engineering support including product updates and training to our focus partners and customers.
   Work with territory team to update and track pipeline opportunities and ensure all technical requirements for success are being met.
   Deliver content and demonstrate expertise to our partner community and customers. - develop white papers, videos, blogs and other content.
   Participate in partner and regional marketing events as required.
   Work closely with product management and engineering on roadmap enhancements, feedback from the field and leading field enablement activities on your core subject
   Maintains a home lab and current certifications in applicable SonicWall solutions including the technical mastery program.
   Assist the SonicWall support organization as required to drive resolution of support cases.
  
  
 
   Required Qualifications:
   
  
   8+ years of experience working in a Presales/Solution engineering or equivalent role .
   Able to travel as required within the region.
   Demonstrated experience in Network Security/Information Security
   Demonstrated ability to discuss the financial and business implications of solutions.
   Experience presenting technical solutions to technical and non-technical audiences including C-level executives in small and large group settings.
   History of success delivering POCs or pilots in a pre-sales environment
   Hands-on expertise in design, migration, configuration and deployment of complex firewall, endpoint wireless, mobile access and email security solutions.
   Familiarity with governance and compliance issues and management/reporting solutions and requirements. Working knowledge of HIPAA, PCI, SOX, FERPA, CIPA, GDPR, etc
   Familiar with Cloud technologies/platform such as AWS,Azure,SAAS,CASB etc.
   Skill set that includes technical level experience with one or more of the following vendor products: SonicWall, Check Point, Palo Alto Networks, Fortinet, Juniper, Cisco,McAfee, Meraki, Sophos, HP/Aruba,Mimecast, Proofpoint, Barracuda, etc.
   In addition, the candidate must have experience with the following technologies: Full range of L2-L7 networking technologies and protocols, NAT, stateful firewall, IDS/IPS, web and content filtering, proxies, email security gateways,SIEM, VPN,SDWAN, encryption (IPsec/SSL), PKI and key management, 802.11/WLAN, Syslog, Netflow/IPFIX, Active Directory and LDAP, reading, interpreting and creating scripts, regular expressions and/or custom signatures, virtualization platforms to include VMware, Hyper-V
   Must have good communications skills
  
  
  SonicWall is an equal opportunity employer. 
  We are committed to creating a diverse environment and is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, and other protected status as required by applicable law. 
  At SonicWall, we pride ourselves on recruiting a diverse mix of talented people and providing active security solutions in 215 countries. 
  #LI-NR5
